discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. To check the operational validity, you need to attempt to create the stack.

By creating a stack from your CloudFormation template, AWS will attempt to provision the specified resources and configurations. During this process, AWS CloudFormation will perform various checks and validations to ensure the template's operational validity.

If there are any issues or errors in the template, AWS CloudFormation will provide feedback and fail to create the stack. This feedback can help identify and address any problems before attempting to deploy the template in a production environment.

Using the "aws cloudformation validate-template" command (option D) can help catch syntax and structure errors in your template but may not cover all aspects of operational validity. A sandbox or test area (option C) can be useful for testing the behavior of your resources but may not fully validate the operational viability of the template.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A.
The aws cloudformation validate-template command is designed to check only the syntax of your template
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/using-cfn-validate-template.html
I think D too

It's not D.
This will only check for syntax errors.

discussion.content: A. To check the operational validity, you need to attempt to create the stack.
Answer is A

A
To check your template file for syntax errors, you can use the aws cloudformation validate-template command.

To check the operational validity, you need to attempt to create the stack. There is no sandbox or test area for AWS CloudFormation stacks, so you are charged for the resources you create during testing.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/using-cfn-validate-template.html

choices.A: To check the operational validity, you need to attempt to create the stack.
choices.C: To check the operational validity, you need a sandbox or test area for AWS CloudFormation stacks.
choices.B: There is no way to check the operational validity of your AWS CloudFormation template.
choices.D: To check the operational validity, you need to use the aws cloudformation validate-template command.

questions.question_text: How can you check the operational validity of your AWS CloudFormation template?

questions.answer_description:
To resolve a dependency error, add a Depends On attribute to resources that depend on other resources in your template. In some cases, you must explicitly declare dependencies so that AWS CloudFormation can create or delete resources in the correct order. For example, if you create an Elastic IP and a VPC with an Internet gateway in the same stack, the Elastic IP must depend on the Internet gateway attachment. For additional information, see Depends On Attribute.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/troubleshooting.html#troubleshooting-errors-dependency-error

questions.question_text: What is a circular dependency in AWS CloudFormation?

choices.B: When Resources form a Depend On loop.
choices.C: When a Template references an earlier version of itself.
choices.D: When a Template references a region, which references the original Template.
choices.A: When Nested Stacks depend on each other.

questions.answer_description:
An elastic network interface (ENI) is defined as a virtual network interface that you can attach to an instance in a VPC and can include one public IP address, which can be auto-assigned to the elastic network interface for eth0 when you launch an instance, but only when you create an elastic network interface for eth0 instead of using an existing network interface.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-eni.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D "create an elastic network interface for eth0" is the default action when creating an EC2 instance.

What does D mean?
I think only when subnet is configured auto-assign public ip, the primary ENI will have public ip when an instance is launched.

comments.content:
D "create an elastic network interface for eth0" is the default action when creating an EC2 instance.
If changed to use an exsiting ENI for eth0, or add a new network interface, public IP won't be auto assigned.

questions.question_text: An elastic network interface (ENI) is a virtual network interface that you can attach to an instance in a VPC. An ENI can include one public IP address, which can be auto-assigned to the elastic network interface for eth0 when you launch an instance, but only when you_____.

choices.A: create an elastic network interface for eth1
choices.D: create an elastic network interface for eth0

discussion.content:
B
You can migrate a virtual interface to a new connection within the same Region, but you can't migrate it from one Region to another. 
Source 
 - 
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directconnect/latest/UserGuide/migratevirtualinterface.html

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. You cannot change the region of your virtual interface after setting up an AWS Direct Connect.

Once an AWS Direct Connect Virtual Interface is created, it is associated with a specific AWS region. The region cannot be changed after the virtual interface is established. If you need to connect to resources in a different region, you would need to create a new virtual interface in that region.
It says what cannot be done, and based on that the answer is definitely B

A is right answer:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directconnect/latest/UserGuide/migratevirtualinterface.html
Note
You can migrate a virtual interface to a new connection within the same Region, but you can't migrate it from one Region to another. When you migrate or associate an existing virtual interface to a new connection, the configuration parameters associated with those virtual interfaces are the same. To work around this, you can pre-stage the configuration on the connection, and then update the BGP configuration.

You can't migrate a VIF from one hosted connection to another hosted connection. VLAN IDs are unique; therefore, migrating a VIF in this way would mean the VLANs don't match. You either need to delete the connection or VIF, and then recreate that using a VLAN that's the same for both the connection and the VIF.

questions.question_text: After setting an AWS Direct Connect, which of the following cannot be done with an AWS Direct Connect Virtual Interface?

choices.D: You can create a hosted virtual interface.
choices.A: You can exchange traffic between the two ports in the same region connecting to different Virtual Private Gateways (VGWs) if you have more than one virtual interface.
choices.C: You can delete a virtual interface; if its connection has no other virtual interfaces, you can delete the connection.
choices.B: You can change the region of your virtual interface.
